title: Can't obtain incremental probability impact from TreeExplainer if data contains pd.Categorical dtype
body:
Hi,

Thanks for the brilliant package.

I'm trying to obtain SHAP values in the probability space due to their much more intuitive interpretation for non-technical stakeholders.

Having tried naively at first, it soon became clear that it's non-trivial (https://github.com/slundberg/shap/issues/963). However, passing `model_output="probability"` to `TreeExplainer()` along with a background data sample ought to handle the instance-level transformations. 

Unfortunately, the model I'm trying to explain is a CatBoost model and the data has a large number of pandas Categorical dtypes. This causes a TypeError when TreeExplainer applies `np.isnan` to a categorical variable (cf. https://github.com/slundberg/shap/issues/432).

Given that CatBoost models are listed in the [docs for TreeExplainer](https://shap.readthedocs.io/en/latest/), would it be possible to introduce support for categorical dtypes?

Also, apologies if this is actually one for the CatBoost team; let me know and I'll relocate it appropriately.
